newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were quietly steady in featureless trade with most traders sidelined due mainly to an absence of fresh incentives, dealers said on Friday.

"The market was quiet and featureless in the morning on lack of fresh factors. There a shortage of players ahead of the long Memorial Day weekend in the U.S., and most people are sitting on the sidelines," a local dealer said.
"But some people are waiting for next Tuesday's release of the (U.S. May) consumer confidence index, for more clues to market direction," he said.
In day-to-day rates, weekend eased 1/16 percentage point to 5-9/16 5-7/16 percent.
Monday/Tuesday and week-fixed were unchanged from Thursday's common 5-5/8 5-1/2 percent, respectively.
Among longer dates, two-months was unchanged at 5-3/4 5-5/8 percent, four-months unchanged at 5-13/16 5-11/16, six-months unchanged at 6 5-7/8 and twelve-months unchanged at 6-3/16 6-1/16 percent.
